Package Model

Class SharedData

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.SharedData
  • public class SharedData
extends java.lang.Object
    The SharedData class is specifically to share data across multiple scenes, such as the id or index of a selected object as well as to offer a central class location for methods that are used on multiple scenes, such as validation of an object's attributes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SharedData

        public SharedData()

    • Method Detail

      • getPartId

        public static int getPartId()
        The getPartId method is a method that returns the next available part id to be used when adding a new part. The part id increases each time this method is called so no two parts will end up with the same id.
        Returns:
        the next available part id for a new part.

      • getProductId

        public static int getProductId()
        This is a method that returns the next available product id to be used when adding a new product. The product id increases each time this method is called so no two products will end up with the same id.
        Returns:
        the next available part id for a new part.

      • decreasePartId

        public static void decreasePartId()
        This method decreases the next available part id by 1 and is called only when the user clicks the cancel button on the AddPart view. This way, the unused part id can be offered again for the next possible new part being created and will keep the part id from being accidentally increased when no new part was added.

      • decreaseProductId

        public static void decreaseProductId()
        This method decreases the next available product id by 1 and is called only when the user clicks the cancel button on the AddProduct view. This way, the unused product id can be offered again for the next possible new product being created and will keep the product id from being accidentally increased when no new product was added.

      • getSelectedPartIndex

        public static int getSelectedPartIndex()
        This is the getter method for retrieving the saved selected part index.
        Returns:
        the index of the select part as an int.

      • setSelectedPartIndex

        public static void setSelectedPartIndex​(Part p)
        This is the setter method for setting the int of the selected part index.
        Parameters:
        p - the part that is selected to be compared to the Inventory list of parts to save the index of the part provided.

      • setSelectedProductIndex

        public static void setSelectedProductIndex​(Product p)
        This is the setter method for setting the int of the selected product index.
        Parameters:
        p - the product that is selected to be compared to the Inventory list of products to save the index of the product provided.

      • getSelectedProductIndex

        public static int getSelectedProductIndex()
        This is the getter method for retrieving the saved selected product index.
        Returns:
        the index of the select product as an int.

      • isFirstCreate

        public static boolean isFirstCreate()
        This method determines if this is the first time the Program has started up, so test data can be added once at the beginning of running and not added again.
        Returns:
        the boolean isFirstCreate or the opposite of that boolean depending on the result of the boolean when this method is called.

      • validatePart

        public static boolean validatePart​(java.lang.String idText,
                                   java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String priceText,
                                   java.lang.String stockText,
                                   java.lang.String minText,
                                   java.lang.String maxText,
                                   java.lang.String uniqueText,
                                   java.lang.Boolean inHousePart)
        This method validates various strings provided to see if all the provided strings contain the correct information to create the specified part.
        Parameters:
        idText - This string needs to contain an int.
        name - This string needs to not be empty.
        priceText - This string needs to contain a double.
        stockText - This string needs to contain an int and be a number between the min and max.
        minText - This string needs to contain an int and be less than the maxText int.
        maxText - This string needs to contain an int and be more than the minText int.
        uniqueText - This string needs to not be empty. If the boolean inHousePart is true this will also need to be an int.
        inHousePart - This is the boolean showing what class the part will be, to change how unique text is validated. If the boolean is true, uniqueText will need to be an int for machineId. If this is false, uniqueText just needs to not be empty.
        Returns:
        boolean of true if all validation criteria is met, and a result of false if any criteria is not met.

      • validateProduct

        public static boolean validateProduct​(java.lang.String idText,
                                      java.lang.String name,
                                      java.lang.String priceText,
                                      java.lang.String stockText,
                                      java.lang.String minText,
                                      java.lang.String maxText)
        This method validates various strings provided to see if all the provided strings contain the correct information to create the specified product.
        Parameters:
        idText - This string needs to contain an int.
        name - This string needs to not be empty.
        priceText - This string needs to contain a double.
        stockText - This string needs to contain an int and be a number between the min and max.
        minText - This string needs to contain an int and be less than the maxText int.
        maxText - This string needs to contain an int and be more than the minText int.
        Returns:
        boolean of true if all validation criteria is met, and a result of false if any criteria is not met.

      • productValidationError

        public static java.lang.String productValidationError​(java.lang.String idText,
                                                      java.lang.String name,
                                                      java.lang.String priceText,
                                                      java.lang.String stockText,
                                                      java.lang.String minText,
                                                      java.lang.String maxText)
        This method returns an error message for what caused the validation method for this product to return as false.
        Parameters:
        idText - This string needs to contain an int.
        name - This string needs to not be empty.
        priceText - This string needs to contain a double.
        stockText - This string needs to contain an int and be a number between the min and max.
        minText - This string needs to contain an int and be less than the maxText int.
        maxText - This string needs to contain an int and be more than the minText int.
        Returns:
        a detailed error message in a string to be displayed to the user about why the entered information is not valid.

      • partValidationError

        public static java.lang.String partValidationError​(java.lang.String idText,
                                                   java.lang.String name,
                                                   java.lang.String priceText,
                                                   java.lang.String stockText,
                                                   java.lang.String minText,
                                                   java.lang.String maxText,
                                                   java.lang.String uniqueText,
                                                   java.lang.Boolean inHousePart)
        This method returns an error message for what caused the validation method for this part to return as false.
        Parameters:
        idText - This string needs to contain an int.
        name - This string needs to not be empty.
        priceText - This string needs to contain a double.
        stockText - This string needs to contain an int and be a number between the min and max.
        minText - This string needs to contain an int and be less than the maxText int.
        maxText - This string needs to contain an int and be more than the minText int.
        uniqueText - This string needs to not be empty. If the boolean inHousePart is true this will also need to be an int.
        inHousePart - This is the boolean showing what class the part will be, to change how unique text is validated. If the boolean is true, uniqueText will need to be an int for machineId. If this is false, uniqueText just needs to not be empty.
        Returns:
        a detailed error message in a string to be displayed to the user about why the entered information is not valid.
